title: Mexican authorities destroy 14 homemade armored cars used by drug cartels
description: The armored vehicles are known in Mexico as "monstruos," or "Monsters."

title: WATCH:  Strong winds send shopping carts across parking lot
description: Powerful winds sent carts racing across a shopping center parking lot in Oklahoma.

title: 1 dead, 10 injured in shooting at party in St. Louis office building: Police
description: A shooting at a party in a downtown St. Louis office building injured at least 10 and killed one person, St. Louis Police Chief Robert Tracy said at a press conference.

title: Man stabs pit bull to death in Central Park after argument between dog walkers
description: A man stabbed a pit bull to death in New York City’s Central Park after a verbal dispute with the dog’s owner

title: Judge in Trump's federal case has acted like 'Trump advocate in a robe': Whitehouse
description: Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse said it remains to be seen whether Judge Aileen Cannon, assigned to Trump’s federal case, can act independently

title: Bus driver arrested on DUI charge while driving Pirates from Chicago to Milwaukee
description: A bus driver has been arrested on a charge of driving under the influence while transporting the Pittsburgh Pirates from Chicago to Milwaukee for their weekend series with the Brewers

title: State trooper killed, another wounded in shootings that left suspect dead
description: A state trooper was killed and another was critically injured during two violent encounters with the same armed suspect in central Pennsylvania, authorities said.

title: David Freese declines induction into the St. Louis Cardinals' Hall of Fame
description: David Freese has decided to decline his induction into the St. Louis Cardinals’ Hall of Fame

title: At least 20 people shot, 1 fatally, at Juneteenth celebration near Chicago
description: At least 20 people were shot, one fatally, when gunfire erupted early Sunday at a Juneteenth celebration in a suburban Chicago, authorities said.

title: Asa Hutchinson predicts Trump may try to pardon himself if reelected
description: Donald Trump may try to pardon himself in the event he is convicted of criminal charges but also reelected, former Arkansas Gov. Asa Hutchinson said Sunday on "This Week"

title: Both sides suffer heavy casualties as Ukraine strikes back against Russia, UK assessment says
description: British officials say Russia and Ukraine are suffering high numbers of military casualties as Ukraine fights to dislodge the Kremlin’s forces from occupied areas in the early stages of its counteroffensive

title: The woman who founded Father's Day was a renegade, great-granddaughter says
description: You could call her the mother of Father’s Day

title: Sudan begins a cease-fire ahead of a pledging conference to raise funds for humanitarian assistance
description: Sudan’s warring parties have begun a cease-fire, as two months of fighting pushed the African nation into further chaos

title: 5 injured in shooting at Gorge Amphitheatre campground, sheriff says
description: A suspect was detained in an alleged shooting at a campground near the Gorge Amphitheatre in Washington, the sheriff said.

title: South Carolina GOP votes to move back their 2024 primary: Sources
description: If approved, the move would put the the first-in-the-South presidential primary state front and center in the race for more than two full weeks.

title: West Virginia basketball coach Bob Huggins resigns hours after drunken driving arrest
description: The coach was suspended earlier for controversial comments in interview.

title: Suspect arrested after FBI uncovers alleged mass shooting plot
description: A suspect who allegedly professed neo-Nazi ideologies online was arrested after federal investigators allege he planned a mass shooting.

title: Biden holds 1st reelection rally after rolling out major union endorsements
description: President Joe Biden kicked off the first reelection campaign rally in Philadelphia after rolling out major union endorsements.
